comments.body:
Having completed this process, the following source values are in production:
```
local
nad
ulan
viaf
lcnaf
lcsh
snac
```

Please consult the [source codes](https://www.loc.gov/standards/sourcelist/subject.html) for $2 for subjects (MARC 6XX fields) and the [source codes](https://www.loc.gov/standards/sourcelist/name-title.html) for $2 in names and title headings (1XX/7XX/8XX fields). Hope this helps.

@Will-Clements 
SC will need to consult the source codes list please to identify which ones are still invalid. We are aware of `viaf`, but there may be others.

After deduping, the following source codes are in production:
```
aat
gmgpc
lcsh
lcnaf
local
mesh
rbgenr
tgn
ftamc
viaf
rbprov
rbpri
tgm
faat
alcsh
abne
homoit
```

@Will-Clements
SC will need to consult the source codes list please (see #466 ) to identify which ones are still invalid. We are aware of `viaf`, but there may be others.

aspace_helpers.title: run Subjects through OpenRefine reconciliation service

comments.body:
LCSH does not integrate directly with OpenRefine, see here: https://forum.openrefine.org/t/how-to-reconcile-with-library-of-congress-authorities/589

We need to run a service like https://github.com/cmharlow/lc-reconcile locally. Needs to be tested.

bibdata.title: Display embargo dates in Restrictions Note

comments.body: @rladdusaw @jrgriffiniii I'm a bit confused on this one. Could we add an example of a record where this "works" in the ticket created last week https://github.com/pulibrary/orangetheses/issues/77. We had worked out the parsing of the embargo dates in this class earlier in the year? https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/main/marc_to_solr/lib/embargo_date_extractor.rb. The date extractor should produce a human readable version of the date for display in the note.

Working example: https://bibdata-staging.princeton.edu/bibliographic/99127127233306421
Example with error: https://bibdata-staging.princeton.edu/bibliographic/99129112208406421

orangelight.title: Wireframe an interface for switching algorithms.

comments.body:
Something to start with:
[Private Zenhub Image](https://api.zenhub.com/attachedFiles/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBeHV0QVE9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--011b0773f324e67a6961072c1e4ef9c63eb3b731/Screenshot%202023-11-07%20at%207.41.00%E2%80%AFAM.png)

This look like a good start! I'm looking at the other dropdowns and their labels give and indication of what the current selection is. So maybe this new one should say "Default relevance"? and then the other options would be like "Cat boost relevance"?

From meeting discussion:
![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 11 22 57 AM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/1599081/103a8d51-d015-4aac-851b-5ef5adad42e4)
![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 7 41 00 AM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/1599081/3ba342f6-00df-49b9-b31c-99b624293870)

orangelight.title: Enable highlighting in catalog_controller behind a flipper feature

comments.body:
This pr works with this work from [pul_solr](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/374). 
regarding [pul_solr/pull/374](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/374) ideally we want a separate search handler so that we dont build a highlighting element on the fly with the current search handler we use in solr.

current implementation activates highlighting feature in the catalog_controller based on the configuration in pul_solr. 
Potential tickets that need to be resolved:

- Records in the results page that don't have a search term in the fields that are specified in the solrconfig.xml `hl.fl` highlighting search component will not display the specific field in the search results. For example 1.`title` will be replaced by the unique record id. 2. `Author` will not display.

orangelight.title: Add a search builder that allows use of a new request handler

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/63813044/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/63813044)

coverage: 95.448% (+0.01%) from 95.437%
when pulling **bb995c8a53f3ef122b7522ae43d49ff8a14c5f27 on 3808-search-algo**
into **2fe492168a12ccabc5678c48fc3cec762cd8be02 on main**.

I had a hard time finding any examples of similar sorts of calls to action in search interfaces, however I also went through favicons and other different UX articles and came up with a few things we could try:

## Options
* Keep the megaphone icon, to harmonize with what is on the catalog homepage
* Remove the icon altogether
* Go with one of the following (screenshot and icon name from [Bootstrap Icons](https://icons.getbootstrap.com)):

![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 17 20 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/2e191290-e0fa-4f2d-80ad-1be779185c8f) ![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 17 30 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/431c0a68-3685-4265-982d-afdd280f234c)
`flag` or `flag-fill`

![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 18 54 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/8199a5f9-cf0d-4c81-8713-9c8447d2034a)
`person-raised-hand`

![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 20 43 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/1b666236-66b3-4d74-a07f-01914a5b7e57) ![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 20 38 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/1a955042-6046-4c0d-ac4b-c0ceec870ac3)
`binoculars` or `binoculars-fill`

![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 21 55 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/c930e12d-09f5-459a-b419-2332c938bf15)
`card-list`

![Screenshot 2023-11-07 at 3 22 02 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/assets/7795797/022da9ee-8f9a-4f32-89cd-f851be8bc017)
`list-columns-reverse`

Some sources consulted, listing here for ease of reference:

Statements on harmful content (none of these catalogs had calls to action within items or search results that I could find):
* https://hornbakelibrary.wordpress.com/2019/02/26/offensive-content-in-our-collections/ 
* https://biblio.csusm.edu/content/potentially-harmful-language-and-content 
* https://library.umkc.edu/policies/harmful-content/ (couldn't search the catalog without a UMKC account)
* https://library.temple.edu/policies/scrc-statement-on-potentially-harmful-language-in-archival-description-and-cataloging 
* https://www.archives.gov/research/reparative-description/harmful-content 

Other consulted pages:
* https://www.libraryjournal.com/story/Writing-and-Implementing-a-Statement-to-Remediate-Harmful-Language-in-the-Library-Catalog-Peer-to-Peer-Review
Put this behind the flipflop feature flipper, ([example for Firestone locator in Orangelight here](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/commit/39e8b6a8b4c763a5aa89d3082d9eff450c07787b)).

princeton_ansible.title: First steps to nginx config template

comments.body:
Known remaining work to a first-round merge:
- [x] add a directory for templated config
- [x] include the templated config directory in the main nginx config file, so both static and templated config files are loaded by the load balancer
- [x] update the task to send the templated files to that new directory
- [x] remove the `template_test` tag
- [ ] find a way to remove unneeded/old files from the /etc/nginx/conf.d/dynamic directory
- [ ] make sure the SSL directories on the load balancer match the directory names in the /etc/nginx/conf.d/dynamic/*.conf files.  Use roles/nginxplus/vars/main.yml to create the SSL certificates in the appropriate directory structure.
- [ ] Update /etc/nginx/nginx.conf to include the dynamic directory configs, either manually or by running playbooks/nginxplus_production_rebuild.yml.
- [ ] test playbook again

pul_solr.title: [ORANGELIGHT] creating a V3 solr config to apply a new search handler

comments.body: It would be better to have a separate handler for highlighting. Similar to what we did in advanced search.

Update: After I destroyed lando and ran the servers again I was able to see in the solr response only the fields I set in the solrconfig.xml as I was expected to. [This is not an issue any more](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/374#issuecomment-1798451732) ``` "highlighting":{ "9974894583506421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":["Pregnancy among black teenagers [electronic resource] : hearing before the Subcommittee on Public Assistance and Unemployment Compensation of the Committee on Ways and Means, House of Representatives, Ninety-ninth Congress, second session, February 18, 1986."], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99126857188706421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":["The lives of Black and Latino teenagers in a low-income : examining methodological issues when conducting a neighborhood ethnography / Randall Clemens."], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99129071662406421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":["Pregnancy among black teenagers : hearing before the Subcommittee on Public Assistance and Unemployment Compensation of the Committee on Ways and Means, House of Representatives, Ninety-ninth Congress, second session, February 18, 1986. [1986]"], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99125476820706421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":[], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99127972072106421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":[], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99125315781206421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":[], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99109623506421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":["Runnin' down some lines : the language and culture of Black teenagers / Edith A. "], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99120646253506421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":[], "title_vern_display":[]}, "9942872243506421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":[], "title_vern_display":[]}, "99126846939806421":{ "author_display":[], "title_display":[], "title_vern_display":[]}}} ```

With @rladdusaw @regineheberlein @VickieKarasic @kevinreiss we looked into adding a new `<requestHandler name="search" class="solr.SearchHandler" default="false">` or with no default at all. Solr doesn't like the idea and will trigger a bad request. We looked into adding a requestHandler with a name pointing to a differnet url similar to /advanced search but this adds more complexity as we would have to remap all the solr search configuration. We decided for now to use the existing handler which is in production and specify there the fields we plan to higlight see: [hl.fl](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/374/files#diff-0659463048550ce849e4a31385608a450aadd735630790044127b17518b7002fR365). We dont expect to have any performance issues even if we dont activate the feature in orangelight; Solr creates the higlight section on the fly only for the results that are on the page.
